ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: My spanish comprehension and speaking abilities improved significantly over this semester.
Much better grasp of a few structures like pronouns, reflexives, and subjunctive. Gained overall comfortability with the language (especially reading longer texts).
Preterite, imperfect, future tenses, new grammar, current events in the Spanish world
Well-designed course for sharpening Spanish skills. Grammar and vocab are mostly review, but you learn to deploy them in many varied ways.
I furthered my knowledge of Spanish language and culture.
This course helped me think about language in a new way, with a particular focus on grammar I didnt have before

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The emphasis on conversation in the class helped me a lot. Having the class focus on understanding the language versus memorizing the textbook was so much more beneficial to me.

Strengths:
- Great class energy, Juliana was upbeat and made class interesting
- Genuinely engaging texts for the most part, especially towards the end of the term.
- Fun activities (like the trial) around those texts

Weaknesses:
- Class felt limited by having to comply with 130 standards
- Supersite was unhelpful and frustrating (grading errors/ formulaic nature make for a bad experience)

Strengths: Really awesome classmates

Weaknesses: Obsessively strict grading that ruined my interest in Spanish.

well-taught and well-organized, some of the readings such as Hebe Uhart were too difficult and long. Would have been helpful to have in-person class on Wednesday as actually talking with the professor and other students is more effective in terms of learning than asynchronous work.

Strengths: charismatic teacher, engaging lessons
Weaknesses: syllabus did not have a clear focus
The class was very fun overall. However, sometimes it was difficult to understand the rubrics for the assignments, so clarification there would be helpful

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It was my favorite of L 1-3 the last two years.

Yes, although I would mainly recommend it because I believe Spanish is an important language to know. The course was pretty formulaic (Juliana did her best to offset this), and not necessarily groundbreaking, but I definitely learned something and enjoyed the process.
If they care about their sanity or their GPA, no! But, if they want to meet cool people, yes1
Yes, necessary for further Spanish learning and cementing L1 and L2 information.
Absolutely! I loved the double focus on language AND culture.
I would recommend this course because although it can be challenging at times, its worth it because you really learn Spanish
